title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 June 2015 - XWiki
content:

09:49 <vmassol> strike that  
09:49 <vmassol> a browser cache refresh fixed it

12:43 <msmeria1> hello  
12:43 <msmeria1> is now known as <msmeria>  
12:44 <msmeria> can someone take a look at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12247?  
12:44 <msmeria> I reproduce it on all XWiki versions I tested on  
13:03 <lucaa> has quit  
13:11 <msmeria> has quit  
13:11 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:17 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
13:19 <msmeria> has quit  
13:21 <msmeria1> has quit  
13:23 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
13:41 <msmeria> has quit  
13:44 <vmassol> gsmeria: hi  
13:44 <vmassol> I've noticed http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XAFORUM-181  
13:44 <gsmeria> hello  
13:44 <vmassol> I'm not sure what it's about  
13:44 <vmassol> if the work is on l10n then the issue is wrongly placed  
13:44 <vmassol> if the commit is in contrib then it's ok but the issue title is not correct  
13:44 <vmassol> :)  
13:45 <gsmeria> I talked yesterday with Caty and she told me to commit the translation keys on l10n  
13:45 <gsmeria> and also create issues on each app for that  
13:45 <vmassol> why?  
13:45 <vmassol> you create an issue when you need to commit in that project  
13:45 <gsmeria> there are some apps that don't have their translation keys on l10n  
13:45 <gsmeria> yes..  
13:46 <vmassol> so here the project is l10n  
13:46 <vmassol> maybe you're confusing translation keys ans translations  
13:46 <vmassol> l10n contains translations only  
13:46 <vmassol> the translation keys are in the project's code  
13:46 <vmassol> so if what you're doing is committing translation keys then it(s not on l10n but in contrib's github  
13:47 <gsmeria> it was about translations, then, not just the translation keys  
13:47 <vmassol> so to sum up:  
13:47 <vmassol> - fi you need to commit in contr's github then you create issue in that project's jira  
13:48 <vmassol> - if you need to commit translations you can enter them directly on l10n you don't need jiras but if you really want jira you can create them here: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XINFRA/component/12646  
13:49 <gsmeria> I understand, I will move the existing ones there  
13:49 <gsmeria> is that ok?  
13:49 <vmassol> yep  
13:49 <vmassol> thanks  
13:49 <gsmeria> ok. thanks  
13:50 <vmassol> I commented on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/TASKMAN-56  
13:51 <vmassol> but in the future don't create jira issues for translations it's just too much overhead  IMO :)  
13:51 <gsmeria> I've seen it now. thanks  
13:51 <gsmeria> I thought is better to have an issue for each change, it will save me a lot of time IMO too, but I was following the procedures so far :)  
13:52 <vmassol> no the rule is listed here:  
13:52 <vmassol> (rule for jira that is)  
13:52 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HJIRABestPractices  
13:53 <vmassol> adding the l10n example now  
13:55 <vmassol> done :)  
13:55 <vmassol> here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices#HRule:Don27tcreateunnecessaryissues  
13:55 <gsmeria> now it's clearer. thank you  
13:56 <vmassol> cool  
13:58 <gsmeria> @vmassol: I have already created 4 issues FYI, so I will move just those on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XINFRA/component/12646  
13:58 <vmassol> ok
